text: a man with a surprise up his sleeve in
Westminster this morning UKIP's
leadership set out its next steps the
party's ambition to take Britain out of
the EU has been met and for Nigel Farage
that meant job Danny I have never been
and I've never wanted to be a career
politician my aim in being in politics
was to get Britain out of the European
Union that is what we voted for in that
referendum there two weeks ago and that
is why I now feel that I've done my bit
that I couldn't possibly achieve more
that we managed to get in that
referendum and so I feel it's right that
I should now stand aside as leader of UK
you Kip has been his life for over two
decades but today Nigel farad looked to
relieve the job of leading it would soon
fall to someone else during the
referendum campaign I said I want my
country back what I'm saying today is I
want my life back and it begins right
now thank you
today Nigel Farage insisted Britain's
vote to leave the EU would not have
happened without him and his party and
there is truth in that you can't put an
EU referendum on the agenda and
mobilised the vote for a party with just
one MP UKIP's impact on politics has
been huge Nigel Farage was one of UKIP's
founders in 1994 and stood for the party
in easly the man who'd started off as a
metals trader in the city was heading
into politics he won a seat in the
European Parliament in 1999 and did not
play by the normal rules you have the
charisma of a damp rag and the
appearance of a low-grade bank clerk
ridiculing the institution he wanted
Britain to leave
Faraj wasn't like other politicians with
his rattle laugh and love of a drink
the cameras lapped it up but at first
there was little electoral success it
was mocked by David Cameron in 2006 who
dismissed you kippers fruitcakes loonies
and closeted racists Faraj would have
the last laugh while campaigning for a
seat at Westminster in 2010 mr. farrar
was badly injured in a plane crash
an experience that spurned him on he
resigned the party leadership only to
change his mind within days citing
overwhelming support from you Kipp
members the party won four million votes
and got one MP at last year's general
election douglas Carswell today this is
the tweet mr. Carswell sent out on
hearing Nigel Farage's news proof they
have never had an easy relationship all
for 20 years he plowed a lonely furrow
and he helped ensure that we got the
referendum clearly their differences of
opinion between him and me as to how we
should best win the referendum by being
generous and upbeat and international
istic and optimistic vote leave one that
referendum I I think it's right that
Nigel takes some credit for holding the
referendum as Nigel Farage accepts
himself he splits opinion an ugly rabble
rouser to some a hero to others but if
he really is hanging up his captain's
hat for good politics will certainly
lose some of its color Ben Wright BBC
news Westminster
